profile.ja: 「タンパク質の秘密」について研究しています。タンパク質にも１つずつ個性があり、深く付き合っているうちに「性格」が見えてくる瞬間があります。これが何よりの楽しみです。現在の目標はインシリコの技術を使って、タンパク質の機能がわかるようにすることです。

Chemical curation to improve data accuracy: recent development of the 3DMET database
paper_title.en: Chemical curation to improve data accuracy: recent development of the 3DMET database

paper_title.ja: Current Challenges in Development of a Database of Three-Dimensional Chemical Structures.
paper_title.en: Current Challenges in Development of a Database of Three-Dimensional Chemical Structures.
Three-Dimensional Structure Database of Natural Metabolites (3DMET): A Novel Database of Curated 3D Structures

description.en: A database of 3D structures of natural metabolites has been developed called 3DMET. During the process of structure conversion from 2D to 3D, we found many structures were misconverted at chiral atoms and bonds. Several popular converters were tested in regard to their conversion accuracy. For verification, three canonical strings were also tested. No procedure could satisfactorily cover all the structures of the natural products. The misconverted structures had to be corrected manually. However, a nonnegligible number of mistakes were also observed even after manual curation, so a self-checking system was developed and introduced to our work flow. Thus, the 3D structures in our 3DMET database were evaluated in two steps: automatically and manually. The current version includes most of the natural products of the KEGG COMPOUND collection [http://www.genome.jp/kegg/compound/] and is searchable by string, value range, and substructure. 3DMET can be accessed via http://www.3dmet.dna.affrc.go.jp/, which also has detailed manuals.

publication_name.en: Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling

paper_title.en: Development of new indices to evaluate protein-protein interfaces: Assembling space volume, assembling space distance, and global shape descriptor

description.en: Protein-protein interaction is fundamental to initiate the cellular functions of proteins, and thus structural analyses of protein interfaces are the first step to understand their functions at the molecular level. Although shape complementarities have been used to evaluate the fitness of interfaces, the conventional method did not distinguish between two main components of complementarity, the well-fitting of the surface shapes and the size of the gap regions between the pair of molecules, and could not evaluate the global shape of the interfaces. Therefore, we now propose three new indices to describe protein interfaces: assembling space volume (ASV), assembling space distance (AS-distance), and global shape descriptor (GS). The ASV is calculated using Delaunay tessellation, and the AS-distance is calculated as the ratio of ASV to delta-ASA (accessible surface area). The GS is calculated as the ratio of the volume of Delaunay tetrahedra with a long edge to that of all tetrahedra in the assembling space. To evaluate the feasibility of the three indices, we applied our method to homo-dimer proteins, and performed systematic comparisons with SURFNET by Laskowski and shape complementarity by Lawrence and Colman. As a result, our indices behave differently from the existing ones, and shed light on new features of protein-protein interfaces, as general trends of AS-distances for all protein interfaces. (C) 2008 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of Molecular Graphics and Modelling

paper_title.en: Cloning and sequence analysis of D-erythrulose reductase from chicken: its close structural relation to tetrameric carbonyl reductases

description.en: Sequence analysis of a cDNA for D-erythrulose reductase from chicken liver showed that the deduced open reading frame encodes the protein with a molecular mass of 26 kDa consisting of 246 amino acids. Although the reductase shares more than 60% identity in the amino acid sequence with the mouse tetrameric carbonyl reductase, these two enzymes have many biochemical differences; their substrate specificity, subcellular localization, organ distribution, etc. A three-dimensional structure of D-erythrulose reductase was predicted by comparative modeling based on the structure of the tetrameric carbonyl reductase (PDB entry = 1CYD). Most of the residues at the active site (within 4 Angstrom from the ligand) of the carbonyl reductase were also conserved in the D-erythrulose reductase. Nevertheless, Val190 and Leu146 in the active site of the tetrameric carbonyl reductase were substituted in the D-erythrulose reductase by Asn192 and His148, respectively. The substitutions in the active sites may be related to the difference in substrate specificity of the two enzymes. The phylogenic analysis of D-erythrulose reductase and the other related proteins suggests that the protein described as a carbonyl reductase D-erythrulose reductase.

paper_title.en: D-erythrulose reductase can also reduce diacetyl: Further purification and characterization of D-erythrulose reductase from chicken liver

description.en: We have discovered new characteristics of D-erythrulose reductase, namely, that it can catalyze reduction of not only D-erythrulose but also such diketones as diacetyl, These substrates have a common structure with two neighboring carbonyls possibly in s-cis plane structure, showing that the enzyme may rigorously distinguish between substrates and other compounds. D-Erythrulose reductase was predominantly located in the kidney and the liver of the chicken. The obtained results suggest that D-erythrulose reductase plays an important role in metabolizing alpha-dicarbonyls in animal organs, because these diketones widely occur in natural foods.

paper_title.ja: 農林水産DNAバンク利用マニュアル (3) FASTA, BLASTとmpsrch
paper_title.en: Manual for MAFF DNA Bank: (3) FASTA, BLAST and mpsrch

description.ja: 農林水産DNAバンクでは電子メール，WWWなどを使用して相同性検索をおこなうことができるサービスを提供している．農林水産DNAバンクで利用できる相同性検索のアルゴリズムはFASTA，BLAST，MPsrchの3種類があり，これらはそれぞれ適した利用方法がある．本稿ではこれらを利用するときの手助けとするため，それらの検索アルゴリズムと出力ファイルの読み方を概説した．

paper_title.ja: 農林水産DNAバンク利用マニュアル (2) 核酸とタンパク質のデータベース
paper_title.en: Manual for MAFF DNA Bank: (2) Databases of DNA and protein

description.ja: 農林水産DNAバンクでは核酸配列データベース(GenBank，EMBL，DDBJ)，蛋白質配列データベース(PIR，Swiss-Prot，GenPept)，立体構造データベース(PDB)，モチーフデータベース(Prosite)などをanonymou-ftp，gopher，WWWを通じて利用することができる体制が確立した．本稿ではこれらのデータベースをより有効に活用することを目的として，それぞれのデータベースの概略およびデータエントリの内容を説明し，末端からのアクセスおよび利用方法について解説した．

paper_title.ja: 農林水産DNAバンク利用マニュアル (1) GCG
paper_title.en: Manual of MAFF DNA Bank: (1) GCG

description.ja: 農林水産省DNAバンクでは配列解析用ツールとしてGCG配列解析パッケージが導入されている．GCGで使用できるデータベースはGenBank，EMBL，PIR，SWISS-PROT，Prosite，REBASEであり，これらを用いた数々の解析をおこなうことができる．しかしGCGを使用するには直接コマンド入力が必要なため，コンピュータに不慣れな研究者にとって必ずしも使いやすいものではない．このような背景からGCGメニューその他の周辺システムの開発をすすめ，マニュアルなしで利用することができるシステムを開発，提供している．本マニュアルでは，DNAバンクのサーバへのログインからGCGを利用するためのターミナル設定，GCGの軌道法，GCGMENUの使用法，WWW2GCGの使用法について実例を示しながら説明した．またこのマニュアルはWWWからhttp://www.dna.affrc.go.jp/htdocs/mm/gcgで参照することもできる．
